swe2013.location

Class Bookings

  • java.lang.Object
    • swe2013.location.Bookings

  • public class Bookings
extends java.lang.Object
    Bookings Class for managing booking information - each room stores bookings in a booking object
    Author:
    Anreiter Simon, Moser Victoria Dorothy, Kocman Andreas

    • Method Detail

      • bookForTimeFrame

        public void bookForTimeFrame(long customerID,
                    java.util.Date beginDate,
                    java.util.Date endDate)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new booking for the given time frame
        Parameters:
        customer - customer related to the booking
        beginDate - begin date of the booking
        endDate - end date of the booking
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - will throw IllegalargumentException if end date < begin date or if time frame not available

      • freeForTimeFrame

        public boolean freeForTimeFrame(java.util.Date beginDate,
                       java.util.Date endDate)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks if a certain time frame is available for booking
        Parameters:
        beginDate - begin date of the time frame
        endDate - end date of the time frame
        Returns:
        boolean true, if time frame is available for booking, false if not
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if end date is before the begin date

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        generates a string of the booking information
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string consisting of the most important booking information
